intro: Erythrostemon caladenia, commonly known as the red lily-lantus, is a striking member of the Plantaginaceae family native to South Australia. This herbaceous perennial features vibrant red flowers with distinctive, spurred petals that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant collections. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is also a subject of conservation interest.
